smell_analysis.justification: All 16 pages of the provided document contain visual modeling elements and content; no empty diagrams were found.
On the Use Case diagram (Page 10), every use case (oval) is connected to at least one actor (e.g., 'Loo kinoseanss' is connected to 'Kinoseansside haldur').
No duplicate use case names were found associated with the same actor. For example, 'Kinoseansside haldur' (Page 10) has distinct distinct actions like 'Loo...', 'Muuda...', and 'Kustuta...'.
In the package diagram (Page 9) and throughout the model, element names are unique within their specific packages/namespaces.

The database diagrams (Pages 12-16) show normalized tables. Relationships are handled via Foreign Keys (e.g., 'pilet' has FKs to 'kinoseanss' and 'koht'), and no disconnected redundant data columns were identified.
Use case naming is consistent on Page 10, using the imperative verb form in Estonian (e.g., 'Loo', 'Muuda', 'Kustuta', 'Vaata').
In the State Diagram (Page 11), all states ('Mitteaktiivne', 'Aktiivne', 'Tuhistatud', 'Loppenud', 'Kustutatud') are reachable via transitions originating from the start node.
In the Activity Diagrams (Pages 7 and 8), all actions (e.g., 'Valib kinoseansi...', 'Kontrollib kas valitud saal...') are reachable from the start node.
Relationships in the Class Diagrams (Pages 1-6) clearly indicate multiplicity (e.g., '1', '0..*', '0..1') at both ends.
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The most populated diagram is the Use Case diagram (Page 10) with 9 use cases, which is within the limit.
No single class or table has 6 or more visual connections on any specific diagram page. The maximum observed is 4 connections (e.g., 'Kinoseanss' on Page 3 and Page 15).
The diagrams are well-laid out with balanced spacing between related elements. No connection distances exceed twice the average.
All use cases (Page 10) start with imperative verbs (e.g., 'Loo', 'Vaata'), and activity actions (Pages 7-8) start with active verbs in the third person (e.g., 'Vaatab', 'Valib').
All class, table, attribute, and use case names are longer than 3 characters. The shortest attributes found were 'kood' (4 chars) and 'Keel' (4 chars).
Class names (e.g., 'Film', 'Kinoseanss', 'Saal') correctly start with an uppercase letter and are singular.
Attribute and column names (e.g., 'nimetus', 'aasta', 'alguse_aeg') correctly start with lowercase letters.
Names do not use Hungarian notation or type prefixes. Identifiers use standard suffixes like '_id' or '_kood' rather than prefixes.
